intro: Silene vulgaris subsp. aetnensis, commonly known as the Aetna campion, is a flowering plant native to the volcanic regions of Sicily. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed habitats, often on the slopes of Mount Etna. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Silene vulgaris subsp. aetnensis is adapted to the harsh, high-altitude environment of its native range.
